thread.title: New Sunderland to London rail service unveiled
thread.title_full: New Sunderland to London rail service unveiled | Tyne Tees - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: New Sunderland to London rail service unveiled
text:
A new rail service between Sunderland and London will run from December 14th 2015.
Virgin Trains will run the service. The company has also announced a new return service from Stirling to London via the North East.
The new Sunderland service will provide better journeys for customers across the region and boost economic ties between the north east and the capital, stimulating growth.
It will play an important role in our ambitious plans to build a Northern Powerhouse and create a balanced, healthier economy.
– Claire Perry, Rail Minister Customers in Sunderland will see a new 05.40 departure, arriving in London King’s Cross at 09.08.
A return service will depart London KX at 20.00. Virgin says both services will be faster than existing direct trains to Sunderland, by seven minutes southbound and 11 minutes northbound.
Delays and cancellations
The East Coast mainline has been beset by problems in recent weeks.
On Thursday September 24th it reported delays of up to 90 minutes. There were more delays on September 15th and cancellations on Thursday September 3rd when a person was a hit by a train that saw many commuters bound for London from the North East abort their journeys at York.
Last updated Fri 25 Sep 2015 Business Sunderland East Coast Main Line
